pullrequest.title: Fix genomedata-open-data interface and usage specification

content.raw: It should be possible to have `gdarchive` still be the last argument even with `--tracknames` having a `nargs='+'` itself. Try adding the `gdarchive` argument *after* tracknames. If that doesn't work, ask on Stack Overflow for another solution.
content.html: It should be possible to have gdarchive still be the last argument even with --tracknames having a nargs='+' itself. Try adding the gdarchive argument after tracknames. If that doesn't work, ask on Stack Overflow for another solution.

pullrequest.title: Fix genomedata-open-data interface and usage specification

content.raw:
So I went back and tried a few different things including your suggestion above and I couldn't get anything to work.

I found the following bug report however:
http://bugs.python.org/issue9338

This is a known issue with nargs='+' and positional arguments, and it has been open for quite some time.

There is some feedback on this issue on stackoverflow:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/26985650/argparse-do-not-catch-positional-arguments-with-nargs

But all the proposed solutions involve changing the interface to use optionals for the one positional argument or using 'action=append' for the list of optionals instead of nargs="+".
content.html:
So I went back and tried a few different things including your suggestion above and I couldn't get anything to work.

I found the following bug report however: http://bugs.python.org/issue9338

This is a known issue with nargs='+' and positional arguments, and it has been open for quite some time.

There is some feedback on this issue on stackoverflow: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/26985650/argparse-do-not-catch-positional-arguments-with-nargs

But all the proposed solutions involve changing the interface to use optionals for the one positional argument or using 'action=append' for the list of optionals instead of nargs="+".

pullrequest.title: Fix genomedata-open-data interface and usage specification

content.raw: OK this seems like the least bad option.
content.html: OK this seems like the least bad option.
